snippet: This alternative to mass-burn incineration, proponents say, disposes of garbage and toxic contaminants while minimizing emissions and providing electricity and usable byproducts.
abstract: Air Force environmental scientist David Robau is promoting a waste disposal method known as plasma arc gasification, which he claims can dispose of garbage with neither the harmful byproducts of conventional incineration nor the environmental impact of transporting and burying waste; some environmentalists express skepticism that the process is harmless.
lead_paragraph: This alternative to mass-burn incineration, proponents say, disposes of garbage and toxic contaminants while minimizing emissions and providing electricity and usable byproducts.

headline.seo: Plasma Gasification Raises Hopes of Clean Energy From Garbage
headline.main: Plasma Gasification Raises Hopes of Clean Energy From Garbage
headline.print_headline: Plasma Gasification Raises Hopes of Clean Energy From Garbage
